definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: W2: The exciting atmosphere of change and development.
sentences.chinese: 那令人振奋的巨变和发展氛围。
我觉得年轻人令人振奋。

sentences.english: It is exciting to be part of this.
sentences.chinese: 能成为其中的一员是多么的令人振奋。

sentences.english: I need to prepare a gourmet menu that's going to be mind-blowing .
sentences.chinese: 我要准备一份能令人振奋的美食家菜谱。

sentences.english: It contains good levels of many nutritious elements. It is stimulating and energy-giving.
sentences.chinese: 它含有多种营养元素，令人振奋并提供能量。

sentences.english: Until the next even-more-wired president, that is.
sentences.chinese: 即使到了下一位更令人振奋的总统上任，它依旧不变。

sentences.english: There is uplifting talk that we are all in this together.
sentences.chinese: 令人振奋的是，我们团结在一起，这是黎明前的黑暗。

sentences.english: The constant struggle to perfect our union is what makes the American story inspiring.
sentences.chinese: 不断完善我们国家的努力使美国的故事令人振奋。

sentences.english: Right. Well, it is wonderfully exciting.
You are the most uplifting person on this site. I mean that.
sentences.chinese: 你是这个网站上最令人振奋的人，我说真的。

sentences.english: W2: The exciting atmo here of change and development.
sentences.chinese: 那令人振奋的巨变和发展氛围。

sentences.english: Her face beautified at the encouraging answer.
sentences.chinese: 听了那个令人振奋的回答后她的脸显得更美了。

sentences.english: Mr. Pim , your success is inspiring.
sentences.chinese: 平先生，您的成功真令人振奋。

definition: to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
